Key Match Events: Shakib Al Hasan scored 64 off 46 balls, including nine fours.
Rishad Hossain took 3 wickets in 4 balls in two overs.
Mustafizur Rahman conceded only 3 runs in the 19th over, taking 2 wickets in the process.
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh made a big stride towards securing a Super Eights berth at the T20 World Cup 2024.
Shakib Al Hasan scored his first fifty in 20 T20I innings.
Rishad Hossain changed the course of the game with his three wickets in four balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Aryan Dutt removed Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto with his second ball.
Sybrand Engelbrecht dived to his left to pick up a catch inches off the turf.
Bangladesh managed only 58 runs in the middle ten overs with five fours and a six, and lost two wickets.
